fields.Title: First Folio! The Book That Gave Us Shakespeare
fields.Description/Abstract:
The Arts and Humanities Institute Gallery was the Idaho site for First Folio: The Book That Gave Us Shakespeare. This national program is sponsored by the Folger Shakespeare Library in honor of the 400th anniversary of the Bard's birth in 2016.
Partners:  Idaho Shakespeare Festival 
Idaho Commission for Libraries
Boise City Department of Arts and History
Idaho Humanities Council
Idaho Center for the Book
Description of Partner:  The project brought a first edition of the rare book, William Shakespeare's First Folio, to Boise State's Arts and Humanities Institute Gallery August 20-September 21 2016. We mobilized University and organizational partners to create programming and publicity, raise funds, network with the schools, provide staffing and security and make the exhibition (free and open to the public) as broadly accessible as possible. Over 8000 visitors attended over four weeks.
My particular role involved the design of exhibitions, including a 16th Century Printing Resource Room and a panel display on the 40th Anniversary of Idaho Shakespeare Festival.
Role:  Co-Principal
